STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
December 20, 2024
Keisha Taylor
CLARENCE FISCHER CENTER
1020 COMMERCE DR,
VASSAR, MI, 48768-9589
Re: License #: CI790363049
SI #: 2025SIC0000104
Dear Ms. Taylor:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Jennifer Pastorick, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2025SIC0000104
Special Investigation Intake Date: November 12, 2024
License #: CI790363049
Licensee Group Organization: Wolverine Human Services
Licensee Designee: Judith Fischer
Chief Administrator: Keisha Taylor
Agency Name: CLARENCE FISCHER CENTER
Agency Address: 1020 COMMERCE DR
VASSAR, MI 48768-9589
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 02/09/2026
Capacity: 60

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Incident reporting
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4150
Section (3) If an institution determines that a youth is absent without legal
Description permission, then the institution shall immediately report the
information to law enforcement, the parent/legal guardian or next
of kin, the licensing authority, and the referring agency.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation One youth went AWOLP (absent without legal permission) this
weekend around midnight and no notifications made until 6am.
Investigation Interviews:
Education Provider 1 was interviewed via telephone on
11/13/2024. Education Provider 1 reported youth routinely
AWOLP (absent without legal permission) from the facility.
Education Provider 1 did not know names of the alleged youth
who went AWOLP around midnight nor did Education Provider 1
know when this occurred. Education Provider 1 did not have any
information regarding if required notifications were made.
Education Provider 2 was interviewed via telephone on
11/18/2024. Education Provider 2 reported overhearing staff,
unable to recall who, talking about Youth A going AWOLP from
the facility. Education Provider 2 reported he did not know when
Youth A went AWOLP and did not have any information regarding
if notifications were made or not.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
11/19/2024. Staff 1 reported he worked first shift on 11/8/2024 and
2

11/9/2024. Staff 1 reported the only youth he was aware of being
AWOLP was Youth A however it was on second shift when Staff 1
was not working.
Education Provider 3 was interview via telephone on
11/27/2024. Education Provider 3 reported Youth B went AWOL
11/9/2024 evening into the morning of 11/10/2024. Education
Provider 3 reported she was called to come to the facility on the
morning of 11/10/2024 due to Youth B breaking into Camp 3 with
another female youth where the school personnel’s offices are
located. The female youth from Vassar House locked herself in
the secretary’s office and staff at the facility did not have a key to
open the door and needed Education Provider 3’s key. Education
Provider 3 reported she arrived at the facility and was informed by
Director of Operations that she was not alerted until 6am of Youth
B being AWOLP. Education Provider 3 reported no staff knew
where Youth B was.
Administrator 1 was interviewed via telephone on 12/11/2024
and 12/13/2024. Administrator 1 reported youth from Clarence
Fischer Center did go AWOL the weekend of 11/9/2024-
11/10/2024. Administrator 1 reported Youth B and a female youth
were found making waffles in Camp 3. Administrator 1 reported
she made notifications of the AWOL to the Facilities Licensing
Consultant and the CMO’s. Administrator 1 reported she notified
the Facilities Licensing Consultant at 2:48am via email.
Administrator 1 reported she notified the CMO’s however did not
recall if it was through email or phone. Upon receiving the worker
notification, Administrator 1 was reinterviewed regarding the time
difference between the Facilities Assigned Consultant being
notified and the referring agency. Administrator 1 reported she
was aware of the required notifications however had only been
with the agency for a month and was unaware at that time whose
responsibility it was to make the required notifications.
Documents Reviewed:
• Wolverine Human Services Critical Incident Response and
Reporting-Residential Programs Risk Prevention
Management Policy: Critical Incidents include AWOLP. The
following entities need to be notified as soon as possible
within 24 hours of the incident if it is considered critical -
Referring Worker/Court Liaison and Department of Child
Welfare Licensing.
• Email dated 11/10/2024 at 2:48am from Administrator 1 to
Facilities Licensing Consultant: Youth B is AWOLP, staff are
still looking for him and police have been contacted.
3

• Screen shot from Administrator 1’s phone showing Youth B’s
worker was notified on 11/10/2024 at 7:15am.
• Behavior Notification for Youth B dated 11/9/2024: On
11/9/2024 Youth B truanted from CFC site. On 11/10/2024
Youth B was located in Camp 3 school office area. The
behavior Notification time of behavior was left blank.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as notifications shall be
made immediately to law enforcement, the parent/legal guardian
or next of kin, the licensing authority, and the referring agency.
Youth B went AWOLP on 11/9/2024 per the behavior notification
however it is unclear on the time of the AWOLP due to the time
section being left blank. The facilities assigned consultant was
notified via email at 2:48am indicating Youth B was AWOLP and
law enforcement had been contacted and notification was made to
the referring agency at 7:15am.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
The facility thoroughly complete reports to include all sections are
filled out properly.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR2024C0001053SI dated 2/21/2024, CAP Approved
3/18/2024
Rule Code Facility and premises maintenance
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4407
Section (1) A facility and premises shall be maintained in a clean,
Description comfortable, and safe condition. The facility shall be located on
land that is properly drained.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Multiple windows are broken and glass is on the ground not being
cleaned up.
Investigation It should be noted Camp 3 is not a building that is licensed by the
Division of Child Welfare Licensing.
Interviews:
Education Provider 2 was interviewed via telephone on
11/18/2024. Education Provider 2 reported youth break windows
on the Campus all the time. Education Provider 2 reported youth
attempted to break into Camp 3 building and the glass was not
cleaned up for two days. Education Provider 2 reported the glass
was cleaned up by Wolverine Human Services staff. Education
Provider 2 reported youth from the facility would not have had
4

access to the glass unless youth would have broken into Camp 3.
Education Provider 2 reported windows have been broken at
Clarence Fischer Center and times vary from an hour or longer
depending on what staff are available to clean up the glass or if it
occurs over the weekend. Education Provider 2 was unaware of
any youth obtaining glass from broken windows.
Education Provider 3 was interview via telephone on
11/27/2024. Education Provider 3 reported in Camp 3 there was a
broken window on 9/3/2024. Education Provider 3 reported she
notified Director of Operations about the broken window and left
the glass to see how long it would take for the facility to clean it
up. Education Provider 3 reported it took three to four days for the
glass to be cleaned up. Education Provider 3 reported youth are
not supposed to be in Camp 3 unless they are testing for their
GED however youth have broken into Camp 3. Education
Provider 3 reported youth break windows at the facility all the time
and maintenance do the best they can do on cleaning up the glass
and repairing the windows. Education Provider 3 reported she has
not seen any broken glass laying on the ground at Clarence
Fischer Center and the facility tries to clean it up right away.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
11/19/2024. Staff 1 reported he has not had a window broken
during any shifts he has worked at the facility. Staff 1 reported the
procedure for when windows are broken at the facility is to remove
the youth from the area while staff, supervisor, or maintenance
clean up the glass and the window is boarded up. Staff 1 reported
maintenance is on call 24/7 and responds to assist in boarding up
windows when needed. Staff 1 reported he has not seen any
glass laying around the facility from broken windows.
Maintenance was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
11/19/2024. Maintenance reported he was called to the facility
last week around 12:30/1am for a broken window. Maintenance
reported he was contacted immediately and went to the facility to
board up the broken window and assist with cleaning up the glass.
Maintenance is on call 24/7 to assist when windows and items are
broken at the facility. Maintenance reported glass from broken
windows is cleaned up immediately by staff at the facility.
Director of Operations was interviewed via telephone on
11/20/2024. Director of Operations reported when windows are
broken at the facility the glass is cleaned up immediately by staff
and/or maintenance depending on who is there. Maintenance
boards up the window while a new window is ordered if the facility
5

does not have the window as an extra onsite. Director of
Operations reported no knowledge of any broken glass not being
immediately cleaned up at Clarence Fischer Center.
Administrator 1 was interviewed via telephone on 12/11/2024.
Administrator 1 reported no knowledge of glass not being cleaned
up at the facility. Administrator 1 reported never seeing any glass
laying around the facility. Administrator 1 reported youth should
not be in Camp 3 at any time.
Administrator 2 was interviewed via telephone on 12/11/2024.
Administrator 2 reported when a window is broken at the facility
the maintenance team comes to clean up the glass and board up
the window until a new window is available to install.
Administrator 2 has not seen any glass laying around the facility.
Administrator 2 reported only school officials are to be in Camp 3
as they have offices located in that building however youth are not
to be in Camp 3.
Tour Observation:
A tour of the outside and inside of Clarence Fischer Center
occurred on 11/19/2024. There were no broken windows at
Clarence Fischer Center and no glass observed on the ground
around Clarence Fischer Center.
Documents Reviewed:
• Email from Administrator 2 to Consultant dated 12/3/2024:
No youth are pursuing GED’s and have not in quite some
time. Administrator 2 is not aware of any spring testing or
candy passing occurring at Camp 3 and will address this.
• Email from Administrator 2 to Educational Provider 2 dated
12/3/2024: youth should not be going to Camp 3 for
anything.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per interviews and tour of
the facility, staff clean up broken glass when it occurs. Per
interviews the broken glass was at Camp 3 which is not a licensed
building and youth are not supposed to be in the building.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Means of egress
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4538
Section (1) Means of egress shall be considered the entire way and
Description method of passage to free and safe ground outside a facility. All
6

required means of egress shall be maintained in an unobstructed,
easily traveled condition at all times.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth broke into "Camp 3" so Wolverine screwed the doors shut.
Investigation It should be noted Camp 3 is not a building that is licensed by the
Division of Child Welfare Licensing.
Interviews:
Education Provider 1 was interviewed via telephone on
11/13/2024. Education Provider 1 reported Camp 3 is the building
where the educational providers are housed at the facility.
Education Provider 1 reported six of nine doors at the building are
screwed shut due to youth breaking into the building.
Education Provider 2 was interviewed via telephone on
11/18/2024. Education Provider 2 reported school offices are in
Camp 3. Education Provider 2 reported youth at the facility attend
classes daily in the classrooms in Clarence Fischer Center.
Education Provider 2 reported the only time youth go into Camp 3
for school activities would be if a youth needs to take a GED test,
to be given candy as a reward for positive behavior, or for spring
testing. Education Provider 2 reported youth rarely go into Camp
3.
Education Provider 3 was interview via telephone on
11/27/2024. Education Provider 3 reported after youth broke into
Camp 3 on 11/9/2024-11/10/2024 the doors were screwed closed
due to the youth breaking the doors. Education Provider 3
reported some of the doors have since been fixed and are no
longer screwed closed however one or two doors remain bolted
closed. The one to two doors that remain bolted closed are in the
front section of Camp 3 where Education Provider 3 reported she
does not have access to.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
11/19/2024. Staff 1 reported there are no doors bolted closed at
Clarence Fisher Center. Staff 1 reported Camp 3 is closed and
used for storage. Staff 1 reported no staff utilize Camp 3.
Maintenance was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
11/19/2024. Maintenance reported there are no doors at the
facility bolted closed. Maintenance reported Camp 3 is not a
licensed building at the facility. Maintenance reported the medical
building on the facility grounds is used by nursing staff and
7

administration. The medical building has locks on the windows
and some bolted closed doors due to youth attempting to break
into the building.
Director of Operations was interviewed via telephone on
11/20/2024. Director of Operations reported there are no doors at
Clarence Fischer Center bolted closed.
Administrator 1 was interviewed via telephone on 12/11/2024.
Administrator 1 reported there are no doors at Clarence Fischer
Center bolted closed.
Administrator 2 was interviewed via telephone on 12/11/2024.
Administrator 2 reported there are no doors at Clarence Fischer
Center bolted closed.
Tour Observation:
A tour of the facility occurred on 11/19/2024 and 12/10/2024.
There were no doors at Clarence Fischer Center bolted closed.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as there are no doors at
Clarence Fischer Center bolted closed. Per interviews doors are
bolted closed at Camp 3 as youth have broken into Camp 3.
Youth are not supposed to be at Camp 3. Camp 3 is not a
licensed building at the facility and is used for storage and
personnel offices.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Fire extinguishers
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4532
Section (4) All fire extinguishers shall be located not less than 4 inches off
Description the floor and the top of the extinguisher shall not be higher than 5
feet off the floor in a special cabinet or on a wall rack which is
easily accessible at all times, unless programmatically
contraindicated. Where programmatically contraindicated, the
required extinguishers may be kept behind locked doors if both of
the following conditions are met:
(b) All staff carry keys to the doors.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Fire extinguishers locked in office area and not everyone has
access to the locked area.
Investigation Interviews:
8

Education Provider 1 was interviewed via telephone on
11/13/2024. Education Provider 1 reported no fire extinguishers
being present in Camp 3. Education Provider 1 inquired with
Administrative Coordinator about location of fire extinguishers in
Camp 3 and was informed they are in the office. Education
Provider 1 reported not everyone has keys to access the office
areas.
Education Provider 2 was interviewed face-to-face on
11/19/2024. Education Provider 2 reported he does have keys to
the office areas in Clarence Fischer Center and has the A key
which Education Provider 2 verified worked on classroom and
main office doors.
Education Provider 3 was interview via telephone on
11/27/2024 Education Provider 3 reported fire extinguishers have
been used by the youth as weapons at the facility. Education
Provider 3 reported the fire extinguisher boxes at Clarence
Fischer Center are all empty and she is unaware of where any fire
extinguishers are located. Education Provider 3 reported she
does not have a key to get into some locked areas at the facility
and did not know if all facility staff had keys to get into all locked
areas.
Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
11/19/2024. Supervisor reported fire extinguishers have been
moved from the fire extinguisher boxes located throughout the
facility due to youth breaking into the boxes and using the fire
extinguishers. Supervisor reported fire extinguishers are now kept
in closets on the pods as well as in the supervisor office.
Supervisor reported all staff have keys to access the fire
extinguishers in the closets however only supervisor have keys to
the supervisor office.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
11/19/2024. Staff 1 reported he has keys that he carries around
the facility that allows him to get into the main areas. Staff 1 was
unaware of any staff not having keys to get into the main areas of
the facility. Staff 1 reported he knows where the fire extinguishers
“should be” at the facility. Staff 1 reported there is supposed to be
a fire extinguisher in the empty box by the door off the cafeteria
area that leads outside, one in the school area, one on each pod,
however the fire extinguishers were moved to the supervisor’s
office. Staff 1 reported he does not have a key to get into the
supervisor’s office as only supervisors have a key.
9

Administrative Coordinator was interviewed face-to-face at
the facility on 11/19/2024. Administrative Coordinator reported
she was just informed during a meeting this morning about fire
extinguishers. Administrative Coordinator reported she was aware
that youth recently set off some of the fire extinguishers at the
facility and Director of Operations is the individual that addresses
the fire extinguishers.
Director of Operations was interviewed via telephone on
11/20/2024. Director of Operations reported youth at the facility
broke the fire extinguisher boxes and used the fire extinguishers
to shoot at other youth, staff, and were threating to hit staff with
the fire extinguishers. Director of Operations reported the fire
extinguishers were moved to the closets on each pod, one is
placed in each janitor closet near the furnace, one is in the staff
break room, and one in the supervisor’s office, and one wet and
two dry extinguishers in the kitchen. In the classroom area in
Clarence Fischer Center, each classroom has a fire extinguisher
and there is one in the school social workers office which all
educational staff have keys to access. Director of Operations
reported the extinguishers are stored on shelves in the closets.
Director of Operations reported there are stickers on the unit
doors indicating where fire extinguishers are located however
youth have been peeling the stickers off. Director of Operations
was unsure if the facility is planning to fix the fire extinguisher
boxes around the facility as they have been posing a safety risk.
Director of Operations reported in the classroom area all the
classrooms have fire extinguishers and there is a fire extinguisher
in the school social workers office. Director of Operations reported
all staff have keys to the classroom and social workers office.
Human Resources was interviewed via telephone on
12/11/2024. Human Resources reported the facility changed the
process of providing staff with keys about two weeks ago. Human
Resources reported previously staff were assigned keys to the
facility after completing orientation and Human Resources
reported no knowledge of any staff not being provided keys at that
time or a lapse in keys being assigned. Human Resources
reported the facility began a process about two weeks ago where
keys are kept in the supervisor’s office and when staff arrive for
their shift, the staff checks in with the supervisor and the
supervisor provides the keys for the shift. At the end of the shift,
staff check out with the supervisor and return the keys. Human
Resources reported all staff have keys to access fire extinguishers
at the facility.
10

Administrator 1 was interviewed via telephone on 12/11/2024.
Administrator 1 reported all staff should have keys to access fire
extinguishers at the facility. Administrator 1 reported prior to her
starting at the facility there was an issue with youth misusing the
fire extinguishers resulting in fire extinguishers being kept behind
locked doors. Administrator 1 reported the facility just transitioned
from all staff being provided with keys to the facility to now keys
being kept in a lock box in the supervisor’s office and at the
beginning of the shift, staff check in with the supervisor and are
provided keys and return the keys at the end of the shift.
Administrator 1 reported the staff keys access all areas where the
fire extinguishers are kept.
Administrator 2 was interviewed via telephone on 12/11/2024.
Administrator 2 reported all staff have keys now to access fire
extinguishers in the facility. Administrator 2 reported the facility
just transitioned from all staff being provided with keys to the
facility to now keys being kept in a lock box in the supervisor’s
office and at the beginning of the shift, staff check in with the
supervisor and are provided keys and return the keys at the end of
the shift.
Tour Observation:
A tour of the facility occurred on 11/19/2024. Throughout the
facility all the areas that youth have access to the fire extinguisher
boxes were empty and no fire extinguishers were in visible sight.
The supervisor’s office had three fire extinguishers stored on the
floor. There were several stickers posted through the facility
indicating where fire extinguishers were located such as above the
empty fire extinguisher boxes.
Documents Reviewed:
• Email from Director of Operations dated 12/3/2024
provided pictures of fire extinguisher placements around
the facility.
• Email from Director of Operations dated 12/9/2024
confirming staff have keys to all locations where fire
extinguishers are located in the facility.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as per onsite inspection on
11/19/2024 the fire extinguishers in Clarence Fischer Center were
stored in the supervisor’s office which not all staff had keys to.
Per interviews, the fire extinguishers were moved in order to be
behind locked doors due to youth inappropriately using the fire
extinguishers which is allowed per the rule however all staff have
to have keys to access the fire extinguishers which staff did not.
11

The fire extinguishers in the supervisor’s office were sitting on the
floor and not 4 inches off the ground.
The facility has since implemented a new key process and all staff
now have access to the fire extinguishers.
Per interviews concerns were reported regarding fire extinguishers
in Camp 3 however Camp 3 building is not tied to this license and
is not a licensed building and youth are not supposed to be in
Camp 3.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Three youth went AWOLP after they threatened a staff and took
the staff's cell phone.
Investigation Interviews:
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
11/19/2024. Staff 1 reported no knowledge of any youth
threatening and stealing a staff’s cell phone and going AWOLP
from the facility.
Administrative Coordinator was interviewed face-to-face at
the facility on 11/19/2024. Administrative Coordinator reported
never hearing anything regarding youth stealing a staff members
cell phone and going AWOLP.
Education Provider 3 was interview via telephone on
11/27/2024. Education Provider 3 reported four youth went
AWOLP from the facility after obtaining a cell phone and calling
someone to pick them up. Education Provider 3 reported she
heard through staff and youth, unable to recall specifically which
staff or youth, that the youth obtained the cell phone from a third
shift staff.
12

Administrator 1 was interviewed via telephone on 12/11/2024.
Administrator 1 reported no knowledge of any youth threatening
and stealing a staff’s cell phone and going AWOLP from the
facility.
Administrator 2 was interviewed via telephone on 12/11/2024.
Administrator 2 reported no knowledge of any youth threatening
and stealing a staff’s cell phone and going AWOLP from the
facility. Administrator 2 reported no staff have informed her of
being threatened and their cell phone taken. Administrator 2
reported back in August youth broke into a storage area where
youth belongings were kept and took a cell phone.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as there was not enough
information to support a rule violation as it is unclear if and when
this incident occurred and who was involved.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
12/17/2024
Jennifer Pastorick Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
December 19, 2024
________________________________________
Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
Area Manager
13
